subject: Re: ClassCastException with dom4j
msgSnippet: ... and ... excluded.properties ... One of the dom4j classes, QNameCache, was failing to load properly. I hadn t tried adding the dom4j packagesto the
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@...> wrote:
>
> jewellgm wrote:
> > Hi All,
> >
> > I seem to be having a classloader problem. I've checked the FAQ
and
> > saw the entry about having org.w3c.dom.* and org.xml.sax.* in the
> > excluded.properties file. I'm using junit 3.8.1, so these entries
> > already exist.
>
> Which class is not loading? Do you have any entry in
excluded.properties
> for /that/ class or package? It's not clear from your message that
> you've done that.
> --
> J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
> Your guide to software craftsmanship
> JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
> 2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
>

One of the dom4j classes, QNameCache, was failing to load properly.
I hadn't tried adding the dom4j packagesto the excluded.properties
file -- I mistakenly believed that just the underlying parsers needed
to be in there.

Thanks for the tip!
